revisions.rev:
{{Infobox Software | name = Vinagre | logo = | screenshot = [[Image:Vinagre.png|250px]] | caption = Screenshot of Vinagre 0.4 under [[Ubuntu (operating system)|Ubuntu]] | developer = Jonh Wendell, David King | latest_release_version = 3.2.1 | latest_release_date = {{release date and age|2011|10|17}} | operating_system = [[Unix-like]] | genre = [[VNC]] client | license = [[GNU General Public License]] | website = [http://www.gnome.org/projects/vinagre/ www.gnome.org/projects/vinagre/] }} '''Vinagre''' is a [[Virtual Network Computing|VNC]] client for the [[GNOME]] [[desktop environment]]. It was included in GNOME 2.22. It has several features, like the ability to connect to multiple servers simultaneously and switch between them by [[Tab (GUI)|tabs]], VNC servers browsing and [[Internet bookmark|bookmarking]]. In version 2.29 Vinagre added controlling [[Video compression|frame compression]], better scaling and [[color depth]]. In version 2.30 it added establishing better [[Tunneling protocol#SSH tunneling|SSH tunnel]] support and better support for copy/paste features between client and server.
The latest version 3.0 will be the one used with Gnome 3.0. Features like [[frame rate]], File Transfer and Audio Support are not yet available.
Vinagre has been included in the default installation as the official VNC client for Gnome, and is the default program used for the Shared Desktop option offered by the [[Empathy (software)|Empathy]] instant-messaging client. Its default server is [[Vino (VNC server)|Vino]].
Future versions of Vinagre are planned to include the ability to connect to Windows-based machines using [[Remote Desktop Protocol | RDP]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://live.gnome.org/Vinagre/RoadMap|title=Vinagre Roadmap}}</ref>
